unnormalised: ## Automotive: Navigating the New Traffic Rules
normalised: Automotive: Navigating the New Traffic Rules

unnormalised: New traffic regulations are now in effect across major Indian cities, aiming to improve road safety and reduce congestion. Experts from IIT Madras contributed significantly to formulating these guidelines. A key change is the mandatory use of rear seatbelts; failure to comply can result in a fine of Rs. 1000.
normalised: New traffic regulations are now in effect across major Indian cities, aiming to improve road safety and reduce congestion. Experts from I I T Madras contributed significantly to formulating these guidelines. A key change is the mandatory use of rear seatbelts; failure to comply can result in a fine of rupee one thousand.

unnormalised: The updated Motor Vehicles Act, effective from 01/01/2024, also emphasizes stricter enforcement against drunk driving. Penalties include hefty fines and potential license suspension. Further, the permissible speed limit on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway has been revised to 100 km/hr, effective immediately.
normalised: The updated Motor Vehicles Act, effective from first january two thousand and twenty four, also emphasizes stricter enforcement against drunk driving. Penalties include hefty fines and potential license suspension. Further, the permissible speed limit on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway has been revised to one hundred kilometer per hour, effective immediately.

unnormalised: Vehicles exceeding permissible emission levels will face increased scrutiny, especially during the periodic fitness tests scheduled for 15/03/2024 at 11:00 hrs. Citizens are encouraged to familiarize themselves with these changes and drive responsibly. Road safety awareness campaigns are planned for 26/01/2024, Republic Day, across various locations at 16:00 hrs to educate the public on these new norms. These measures are intended to create safer roads for everyone, from auto-rickshaw drivers in Delhi to luxury car owners in Bangalore.
normalised: Vehicles exceeding permissible emission levels will face increased scrutiny, especially during the periodic fitness tests scheduled for fifteenth march two thousand and twenty four at eleven o’clock. Citizens are encouraged to familiarize themselves with these changes and drive responsibly. Road safety awareness campaigns are planned for twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty four, Republic Day, across various locations at sixteen o’clock to educate the public on these new norms. These measures are intended to create safer roads for everyone, from auto-rickshaw drivers in Delhi to luxury car owners in Bangalore.
